io.github.utk003.util.data.reference

Class OnceModifiableReference<K>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.utk003.util.data.reference.OnceModifiableReference<K>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - The type of the object to wrap

    public final class OnceModifiableReference<K>
extends Object
    A once-modifiable mutable reference for objects of data type K.

    This class is equivalent to FinitelyModifiableReference, but with a limit of exactly one modification. Note that initializing the reference in the constructor counts as a modification, so this class can be used as a final instance variable that gets initialized in an init() method rather than in the constructor itself.

    Since:
    1.3.0
    Version:
    March 19, 2021
    Author:
    Utkarsh Priyam (utk003)
    See Also:
    FinitelyModifiableReference

    • Constructor Detail

      • OnceModifiableReference

        public OnceModifiableReference()
        Creates a once-modifiable reference initialized to null.

      • OnceModifiableReference

        public OnceModifiableReference(K init)
        Creates a once-modifiable reference initialized to init.

        This initialization in the constructor counts as a modification.

        This constructor is equivalent to doing 

         ref = new OnceModifiableReference();
 ref.setValue(init);
        Parameters:
        init - The value to initialize this reference to

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public K getValue()
        Returns the object stored inside this reference (within value).
        Returns:
        The object enclosed within this reference

      • setValue

        public void setValue(K newValue)
        Sets the object stored in this reference (in value) to the new value stored in newValue if and only if modifications to this reference are still allowed.
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new value of the reference
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - If this reference has already been modified
        See Also:
        canBeModified()

      • canBeModified

        public boolean canBeModified()
        Returns whether or not this reference can still be modified.

        If the return value of this method is false, then any call to setValue(Object) will result in an UnsupportedOperationException.

        Returns:
        true, if this reference can still be modified; otherwise, false
        See Also:
        setValue(Object)
